We came with the answers; now we shall leave
with the questions. How ironic it is to find that higher
education has not given us what we thought we really
came for: all the answers. In reality it has shown us that
there are a multitude of unanswered questions facing this
earth; it has made us aware of these questions, and has
developed the tools we brought witli us so that we might
correctly answer them. We had the answers all along; it
was what they were the answers to that really brought us
to Hopkins. This was our real challenge, and it shall continue to be so.
It is for the future to tell us how we have met this
challenge. Some of us will meet it sqaurely, as in research,
while others will serve to broaden it through development;
some will choose to carry the challenge to still more people
by returning to education; still others will not answer the
challenge, but only create more questions and hence more
challenges. We are all 'Hopkins Men' now, each with a
sphere of influence, just like our University. Or perhaps
we would rather feel that we have enlarged the sphere
that surrounds Johns Hopkins.
